page.title: 19HOME LIFE (2)
page.content: {A day in the life of a Senior Citizen. It is 7.30 am, I am awakened by the buzzing of the Teasmade alarm. Open- ing my eyes, I think - what day is it? Ah, Thursday, I must collect my DHSS pension from the Post Office and the milk and newspapers from the village store. I return home to breakfast of grapefruit, cereals/bacon and egg/ toast with marmalade. At 9.30 am I embark on the local coach to Truro where I do my special shopping, select books at the Library, and take refreshment in a nearby cafe. At l2.30 pm I rejoin the coach and return home. Lunch over, I spend 2 hours writing or gardening, then walk to Holywell Bay and home for tea. In the evening I relax either by reading watching TV or meeting friends. After refreshment I retire at l0.45 pm.
